noun.description: A traditional and widely accepted way of behaving or doing something that is specific to a particular society, place, or time.
examples: the old English custom of dancing around the maypole
custom demanded that a person should have gifts for the child

noun.description: Regular dealings with a shop or business by customers.
examples: if you keep me waiting, I will take my custom elsewhere

adjective.description: Made or done to order for a particular customer.

origin: Middle English: from Old French coustume, based on Latin consuetudo, from consuetus, past participle of consuescere accustom, from con- (expressing intensive force) + suescere become accustomed.
